TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and at the relevant time he lived in PERSON . At present he lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . In TIME of DATE the applicant ’s wife warned the police by telephone that the applicant intended to drive his car after having drunk alcoholic beverages , that he carried a weapon , that his behaviour was strange and that it was possible that he could cause injury to other persons . Upon this information the police stopped the car driven by the applicant . As the applicant actively resisted his search , the police handcuffed him . A sword was taken away from him . The analysis of his breath indicated that the applicant had alcohol in his blood . According to the applicant , the breath test was forged .

CARDINAL . The police brought the applicant to a police station , where they withdrew his driving licence . Subsequently he was brought to a psychiatrist . After a short examination the applicant was released . Later on DATE the doctor issued a certificate , at the request of the applicant ’s wife , in which the police were requested for assistance in transporting the applicant to a mental hospital .

CARDINAL . NORP In TIME CARDINAL DATE the applicant returned to his home but he could not unlock the door . He asked the police for assistance . Upon the arrival of the police the applicant ’s wife opened the door and asked that the applicant be taken away . He was brought to a mental hospital in an ambulance . After he had refused to undergo an examination , the applicant was brought against his will to another hospital . Medicaments were administered to him during DATE and he had to undergo psychiatric tests .

CARDINAL . On DATE the administration of the hospital to which the applicant had been brought on DATE informed the ORG about the applicant ’s detention on account of the suspicion that he suffered from a mental disorder .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG delivered a decision by which it started proceedings , with reference to ORG CARDINALa ( CARDINAL ) and PERSON ( CARDINAL ) of LAW , with a view to determining whether the applicant ’s placement in a mental hospital was justified . By another decision delivered on DATE ORG appointed a guardian to defend the applicant ’s rights in the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE a record concerning the applicant ’s detention in the mental hospital was drawn up in the presence of the applicant , the ORG judge dealing with the case and the doctor who treated the applicant . Reference was made to statements of the wife according to which the applicant ’s behaviour had changed following his return from GPE where he had been on business for DATE . According to her , the applicant alleged hearing strange voices and that his flat was monitored from outside by means of a fax machine . He had altercations with his colleagues and started carrying weapons . His wife feared that the applicant wanted to drown her in the bath and stated that he had not allowed their children to go to school . The applicant denied such allegations and explained that there had been disagreements between him and his wife . He affirmed that he was not ill and refused examination by psychologists . The record further stated that the applicant was being treated with medicaments and that his brother suffered from paranoid schizophrenia . It concluded that a professor would decide on DATE whether further treatment was necessary .

CARDINAL . In a decision delivered on DATE the ORG found that the applicant ’s detention in the mental hospital was lawful . Reference was made to the ORG presumption that the applicant suffered from a mental disorder and to the fact that he was treated with medicaments .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was released from the hospital .
CARDINAL . On DATE the president of the ORG apologised to the applicant for the delay in serving on him the above decision of CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant was allowed to consult the court ’s case file . On this occasion he was served with ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE concerning the lawfulness of his examination in a mental hospital . On DATE and on CARDINAL DATE the applicant appealed against this decision and also against the decision of DATE on the appointment of a guardian . He alleged , in particular , that his arrest had been unjustified , that he had been heard by a judge on DATE , that is DATE after his arrest , and that the court had taken DATE to decide on the lawfulness of his detention contrary to the relevant law .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the appeal . It found that the applicant ’s detention had been justified by his strange behaviour and by the ORG presumption that he had suffered from a mental disorder . ORG considered irrelevant the applicant ’s objection concerning the delay in deciding on his case at first instance and in serving the ORG decision of DATE .

CARDINAL . DATE ( CARDINAL ) provides that a court has to be notified , within TIME , of a person ’s detention in a medical institution without his or her consent . Courts are obliged to decide on such a detention within DATE .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINALa ( CARDINAL ) provides that medical institutions are obliged to inform the competent court , within TIME , of the detention of any person without his or her written consent .
CARDINAL . Under Section CARDINALb ( CARDINAL ) , the court shall start proceedings upon such a notification with a view to determining whether the interference was justified .
CARDINAL . Pursuant to paragraph CARDINAL of Section CARDINALb , the court shall appoint a guardian to the person concerned unless he or she has a representative .

CARDINAL . Paragraph CARDINAL of Section PERSON provides that the court shall take evidence with a view to determining whether the person was placed in a medical institution in accordance with the law . It shall hear both the person concerned and his or her doctor .

CARDINAL . Pursuant to paragraph CARDINAL of Section CARDINALb , the court shall decide on the lawfulness of the interference within DATE from the moment when the person concerned was brought to the hospital .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINALc ( CARDINAL ) provides , inter alia , that a judicial decision under LAW ( CARDINAL ) shall be served on the person concerned within TIME after it has been taken and not later than five days from the moment when his or her liberty was restricted unless the doctor indicates that such a person is not capable of understanding its contents .
